1.text: The kingâ€™s heart is in the hand of the LORD, as the rivers of water: he turns it wherever he will.

2.text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes: but the LORD ponders the hearts.

3.text: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.

4.text: An high look, and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, is sin.

5.text: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenty; but of every one that is hasty only to want.

6.text: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.

7.text: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.

8.text: The way of man is fraudulent and strange: but as for the pure, his work is right.

9.text: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.

10.text: The soul of the wicked desires evil: his neighbor finds no favor in his eyes.

11.text: When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receives knowledge.

12.text: The righteous man wisely considers the house of the wicked: but God overthrows the wicked for their wickedness.

13.text: Whoever stops his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.

14.text: A gift in secret pacifies anger: and a reward in the bosom strong wrath.

15.text: It is joy to the just to do judgment: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

16.text: The man that wanders out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.

17.text: He that loves pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loves wine and oil shall not be rich.

18.text: The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.

19.text: It is better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman.

20.text: There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spends it up.

21.text: He that follows after righteousness and mercy finds life, righteousness, and honor.

22.text: A wise man scales the city of the mighty, and casts down the strength of the confidence thereof.

23.text: Whoever keeps his mouth and his tongue keeps his soul from troubles.

24.text: Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who deals in proud wrath.

25.text: The desire of the slothful kills him; for his hands refuse to labor.

26.text: He covets greedily all the day long: but the righteous gives and spares not.

27.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more, when he brings it with a wicked mind?

28.text: A false witness shall perish: but the man that hears speaks constantly.

29.text: A wicked man hardens his face: but as for the upright, he directs his way.

30.text: There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.

31.text: The horse is prepared against the day of battle: but safety is of the LORD.
